channel.title: Sara R. Dean
channel.description: A digital history portfolio from my first semester in Northeastern University's public history M.A. program.

item.title: Introduction
item.description: A brief introduction to the site and its author.

item.title: What Yuan Artwork Can Teach Us About DPLA's Collections
item.description: My foray into the collections of the Digital Public Library of America (DPLA) and what it has taught me about their contents and composition.

item.title: Raw Data and Its Interpretation
item.description: A reflection on writings by Frederick W. Gibbs and Trevor J. Owens, Lisa Gitelman, Thomas L. Haskell, and Eric Hilt.

item.title: An Exercise in Digitization
item.description: A brief overview of a digtization exercise; my findings and observations.

item.title: An Exercise in Crowdsourcing with Trove
item.description: Reflections on my participation in a crowdsourcing effort.

item.title: Data on 'Executions in the United States,' and what it can tell us about slave revolts
item.description: For the dataset “Executions in the United States, 1608-2002,” race of offender by crime committed, the crime being slave revolt.

item.title: The Ethics of Technological Progress
item.description: A response to this week's readings on computer science projects, and their ethical ramifications.
